results.title: Daybill for the American release of Jedda
results.credit_line: Courtesy the National Film and Sound Archive of Australia.
results.brief_description: Jedda represented a lot of historic firsts for the Australian moving image, not just in the story it was telling but how that story was told. The first fully funded Australian narrative feature to be shot in colour in the country, it used a colour process known as the Belgian Gevacolor so it was possible to shoot on location among the Australian landscape.

results.title: Love serenade
results.creator_credit: Jan Chapman, Mandy Walker, Shirley Barrett, AFFC and Saddleback Productions
results.brief_description:
Two bored sisters, Dimity and Vicki-Ann, live in the small country town of Sunray. Their new neighbour, a brooding self-centered type, formerly star D.J. of a drive-time programme on Brisbane radio, threatens to turn the sisters’ world upside down. Dimity and Vicki-Ann find themselves in competition for his affections as each develops a severe crush on the aging Lothario with a predilection for 70’s music and young women. Awards: Cannes International Film Festival 1996: Camera d’Or for Shirley Barrett. Also available on VHS.

Credits: Producer, Jan Chapman ; director, writer, Shirley Barrett ; photography, Mandy Walker.
Cast: Miranda Otto, Rebecca Frith, George Shevtsov, John Alansu.

results.title: Travelling light. Parklands [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Helen Bowden, Mandy Walker, Kathryn Millard, Soft Fruit, Showtime Australia, South Australian Film Corporation, New South Wales Film and Television Office and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Travelling Light: Set in Adelaide in the 1970s comes writer/director Kathryn Millard’s debut feature film. Leanne Ferris (Pia Miranda) is supposed to be embracing her studies to become a teacher but is caught up in the social change and dynamism of the era when women and youth, in particular, were finding a new generation’s independence. The restrictive nature 1970s Australian society places on the married women in her life (Mum and elder sister Bronwyn) infuse Leanne with a drive to find her own path by becoming a photographer. Sexual forays, drug taking and poetry help shape Leanne’s young adulthood. Cast includes: Sacha Horler, Tim Draxl, Marshall Napier, Heather Mitchell, Simon Burke, Kestie Morassi, Tamblyn Lord. “Parklands” [307794]: Rosie (Cate Blanchett) is a young woman who returns to her home in Adelaide for her father’s (Tony Martin) funeral. This intriguing short film follows the path Rosie takes to solve the mystery of her father’s death. Talking with old friends, looking through diaries and photographs - reliving her childhood, she comes to understand the life of the man she called her father.

results.title: Life
results.creator_credit: Elisa Argenzio, Mandy Walker, Lawrence Johnston, Rough Trade Pictures and Australian Film Commission
results.brief_description: Johnston’s debut feature following on from his award winning shorts ‘Night Out’ and ‘Eternity’, is a dynamic re-visioning of actor/playwright John Brumpton’s theatre piece “Containment” that focused on the situation of inmates in the segregated HIV positive section of an Australian prison. To describe Johnston’s beautifully composed, movingly rendered, emotionally shattering film as ‘an AIDS prison drama’ denies it the full range and reach of its compelling grip on any number of wider issues and universal concerns. Brumpton forcefully fleshes out the lead role of quick-tempered hardened Des, a crim who tests positive and is sent to T2 division. His relationship with his cell-mate Ralph is vividly evoked via subliminal flashbacks and interaction between themselves and amongst the other inmates of T2. Photography, Mandy Walker. Cast: John Brumpton, David Tredinnick, Robert Morgan, Belinda McClory, Noel Jordan.

results.title: Lantana (Special edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jan Chapman, Mandy Walker, Ray Lawrence, Saddleback Productions, Film Finance Corporation Australia and MBP
results.brief_description: Ray Lawrence (Bliss) returned to filmmaking after a sixteen-year absence to direct “Lantana”. Adapted from his own play, scriptwriter Andrew Bovell depicts a dozen characters, reflecting a prism of modern day Sydney. One woman’s death - perhaps murder - sparks a crisis in a series on interconnecting relationships. Leon is a policeman investigating the woman’s disappearance, who’s emotional stolidity is reflected in his violent dealings with clients; his aging wife Sonja seeks counselling for her desolate personal state; her therapist Valerie, is struggling to cope with the death of her teenage daughter and the deterioration of her marriage to John, an emotionally remote academic; Jane, a lonely and aimless woman, is estranged from her husband Pete and seeks sex with Leon. Miscommunication and secret trysts (real and imagined) leads characters to draw false conclusions. Several red herrings increase the intensity of the murder mystery, but the real concern of the film is the kaleidoscope of human failings and interactions, reflecting a complex interweaving of intent and desire. Paul Kelly’s score serves as an effective moody soundtrack to the film. Winner of seven AFI awards. Cinematography by Mandy Walker. Cast includes Anthony La Paglia, Geoffrey Rush, Barbara Hershey, Kerry Armstrong, Rachael Blake, Vince Colosimo, Peter Phelps, Leah Purcell, Glenn Robins.

results.title: Walk the talk
results.creator_credit: Jan Chapman, Mandy Walker, Shirley Barrett and NBCUniversal
results.brief_description: Shirley Barrett displayed a penchant for black comedy with her successful debut feature “Love serenade”. “Walk the talk”, her second feature, is a darkly comic tale about several deluded individuals trying to govern unreachable dreams of stardom. Joey is a con man fresh out of prison after serving a stint for selling fake cellulite cream. His girlfriend is Bonita, confined to a wheelchair, and awaiting a one million dollar compensation payout. Joey’s latest scheme on his road to glory is to sell the minimal talents of Nikki, a bad-tempered singer and dancer. Joey convinces Bonita to bankroll his idea and he creates a plan that will make both him and Nikki rich and famous. The cultural milieu unique to Surfers Paradise in Queensland is milked for laughs - Nikki’s father mocks her for being a showbiz failure, where as he has made it as an entertainer of pensioners between their rounds of bingo. When Joey’s grand scheme to make Nikki a star goes awry, he makes the decision that no act is unworthy if it results in fame, or at the very least infamy, for the pair.

results.title: Worse than Xmas
results.creator_credit: Joanne Aslanis, Mandy Walker and Julie Harris
results.brief_description: Waitress Angela (Kaarin Fairfax) rushes home to save a doomed relationship. When she fails, she agrees with her neighbour that Easter is the worst time of year, even worse than Christmas. The film follows the funny and inevitable diversions that Angela takes to make it through the breakup and start dating again.

results.title: What the Water Gave Me

video_links.name: Florence + The Machine - What The Water Gave Me

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

results.description: The music video for ‘What the Water Gave Me’ intersperses footage of Florence + the Machine’s studio recording sessions with kaleidoscope shots of Welch performing the song, evoking the crashing of waves and reflective quality of water.
description_for_label: The music video for ‘What the Water Gave Me’ intersperses footage of Florence + the Machine’s studio recording sessions with kaleidoscope shots of Welch performing the song, evoking the crashing of waves and reflective quality of water.

results.title: Zulu Zion
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Mischa Scorer and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “The Long Search”.
In this visit to South Africa Ronald Eyre looks at the ways Christianity has evolved into an almost completely different religion, with an emphasis on dreams, purification, healing and the power of the holy spirit. Black Africans separated from the land search to replace these roots in God and the three different Christian sects which are explored here - the Zionists, the Lutherans and the Nazarites, all in their different ways have combined traditional African religion with Christianity. A fascinating look at how two different religions can merge and evolve into something quite unique and alive.
